meanings.sent1: She poohed at the idea of eating broccoli.
meanings.sent2: The child poohed when offered a plate of vegetables.
meanings.sent3: He poohed at the suggestion of wearing a silly hat.
meanings.sent4: The cat poohed at the new brand of cat food.
meanings.sent5: The audience poohed loudly at the terrible performance.

meanings.definition: Past tense of 'pooh', meaning to express disgust or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She poohed at the bad movie they watched last night.
meanings.sent2: He poohed when he saw the messy room.
meanings.sent3: The dog poohed at the strange smell coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The teacher poohed at the students' lack of effort.
meanings.sent5: The crowd poohed in unison at the politician's speech.

meanings.sent1: The baby poohed in his diaper during the car ride.
meanings.sent2: The bear poohed in the woods as nature intended.
meanings.sent3: The bird poohed on the car windshield, much to the owner's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The elephant poohed a massive pile in the zoo enclosure.
meanings.sent5: The cat poohed in the litter box with a satisfied look on its face.
